sub_title: Founder and CEO @ RocketShoes Pty Ltd | Independent Consultant
summary:
I am an educational innovator and consultant with over 25 years of experience in advancing the future of learning. I have a strong background in academia, edtech startups, and strategic leadership roles, where I have led and contributed to various initiatives in pedagogy and technology. I hold an MA in History and Philosophy of Science and a BA, both from The University of Melbourne.

Currently, I am the founder and CEO of RocketShoes, an Edtech startup that has recently pivoted to offer consultancy services in educational innovation, digital strategy and online learning. I was previously the Director of Learning Experiences at Curio, a global consultancy that helps universities deliver exceptional online learning experiences. My mission is to harness the transformative potential of technology to create meaningful and engaging educational journeys for learners of all ages and backgrounds. I am passionate about empowering institutions and individuals to embrace innovation and creativity in education and work.

projects.title: Exemplar Learning Facilities
projects.description: This project involved the development of cutting edge flat floor collaborative teaching spaces designed for mixed purpose uses, including Enquiry Based Learning (EBL) and project learning.  The use of these spaces will be evaluated according to the design principles from the SKG Project, and they serve as prototypes for future classroom development at La Trobe University.

contributors.headline: Founder and CEO @ RocketShoes Pty Ltd | Independent Consultant

projects.title: Higher Education Active Learning Spaces (HEALS) Project
projects.description: HEALS is co-led by La Trobe University and Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia under the IRU-MRUN Collaborative Research Programme. The last couple of decades have seen universities investing significant funds and resources in the construction and retrofitting of learning spaces based on the promise of various Returns on Investment (ROI). This has meant that claims about the influence of active learning spaces on student learning are often not substantiated empirically which in turn means that the Return on Investment (ROI) on learning space development can be difficult to define.  This collaborative research project focuses on the systematic evaluation of recent learning space designs in order to better understand the return on investment and to test the underlying design assumptions to help the universities in moving the field forward. The theoretical approach for this project utilises the Pedagogy, Space and Technology (PST) framework from the Next Generation Learning Spaces project as well as the 7 Principles of Learning Space Design from the Spaces for Knowledge Generation (SKG) Project. Role: Principle Investigator (together with Prof Norazah Nordin, UKM).

contributors.headline: Founder and CEO @ RocketShoes Pty Ltd | Independent Consultant

projects.title: PS3 Adaptive Reuse Project (Project Control Group Member)
projects.description:
La Trobe University will launch new exemplary learning environments in 2015 as a result of this project, involving adapting a large building on the Melbourne Campus.  Departing from the present to envision the possible futures of learning and teaching at La Trobe, the radical redesign of PS3 will provide staff and students with an array of exciting new learning spaces, and that will allow staff to test, implement and evaluate fresh and innovative approaches to learning and teaching.
The project was informed by seven principles of learning space design developed by a La Trobe-led project called Spaces For Knowledge Generation, including comfort, aesthetics, blending and the repurposing of space. Project budget: $15.85M.

contributors.headline: Founder and CEO @ RocketShoes Pty Ltd | Independent Consultant

projects.title: Mobile First MBA: implementation
projects.description: The Mobile First project is an initiative to provide a fully online learning environment for MBA students at La Trobe University that will permit them to learn what they want, where they want, and when they want. Built in conjunction with Academic Partnership International (API), the intention is to create the optimal student experience by utilising the best mobile learning tools. As such, the course will be designed using the functionality of Apple’s iTunes U, the world’s largest repository of education content, and students will be provided an iPad in order to allow easy access to the course from anywhere.

projects.title: La Trobe Hallmark Program (Project Director and Academic Lead)
projects.description:
The Hallmark Program will be a key, distinctive element of future learning at La Trobe University. The program will be designed to attract students with high potential from a diversity of backgrounds and feature significant student scholarship and enrichment elements beyond the classroom experience. It will address some of the nation’s, region’s and world’s most pressing issues.

Being the best in these areas will simply mean studying at La Trobe, and being taught by the best teachers and researchers in the field.

The Hallmark Program will:

• Be closely aligned to a Research Focus Area (RFA) addressing significant global problems
• Be creative, bold and distinctive in its focus and curriculum
• Be in high demand from prospective students
• Be highly selective, but also use innovative selection criteria to identify students with high potential from a diversity of backgrounds
• Feature significant student scholarship and enrichment elements beyond the classroom experience
• Generally include significant cross-disciplinary elements of study
• Typically include elements developed and/or delivered in conjunction with one or more major external partners.

projects.title: Mobile Learning Devices Pilot Project
projects.description:
The Mobile Learning Devices Pilot Project aims to support mobile learning opportunities for students in the Faculty in order to improve access to educational resources that are affordable and timely. The project upholds the principles of sustainability, equity and the thorough integration of educational purposes in using up to date mobile technologies.

Key drivers:
1. World-ready graduates in the age of the mobile office
2. Active learning, including EBL approaches to learning
3. Enriching the student experience, including providing better connections to student life, mentor programs, and social networking
4. Improving student engagement in a world where students split their time between home, work and campus
5. Remaining competitive with other higher education providers
6. Technological change: tablet devices will overtake desktop computers in 2014-15.

contributors.headline: Founder and CEO @ RocketShoes Pty Ltd | Independent Consultant

projects.title: Curriculum Renewal (C-Ren) Project
projects.description: As part of La Trobe University's Design for Learning Project, the Faculty of Business Economics and Law undertook a significant renewal of its undergraduate curriculum starting in 2009.  The C-Ren Project aims to redesign the curriculum with embedded graduate capabilities, beginning with the establishment of evidence-based practices to map the extent to which graduate capabilities are currently being taught and assessed.  For more detail, please see the Staff Stories Interview link under Additional Information in this profile.

projects.title: OpenTab: developing open educational resources for use on tablet devices at La Trobe
projects.description: This project uses an open educational (OE) approach to develop course materials for use on tablet devices. It will apply this approach to the development of materials for use in the FBEL’s new Common First Year Core (CFYC) subjects, being designed during 2012 for delivery in 2013. The project will evaluate this approach in order to determine any issues and to provide a model workflow for other subjects in the university. Role: Project lead. Budget: $20,500.

projects.title: Faculty-Based Learning Commons
projects.description:
Project Sponsor and Chair of Project Steering Committee for the Faculty-Based Learning Commons Project, $1.3m budget, La Trobe University. The project designed and built four new learning commons spaces in three Faculties, including indoor and outdoor areas, flexible group learning spaces and 'eddy spaces'.

This project received a Commendation in the category of Education Initiative or Design solution for an Innovation Program in the 2012 Awards for Outstanding School Facilities, presented by the Victorian chapter of the Australasia Region of the Council of Educational Facilities Planners International (CEFPI).

projects.title: Spaces for Knowledge Generation
projects.description: Spaces for Knowledge Generation is an ALTC project which was undertaken as a partnership between La Trobe University as lead institution, Charles Sturt University, Apple and Kneeler Design Architects. The context of the learning experience necessarily changes over time, with technological, economic and social developments influencing the types of learning spaces learners and teachers require to achieve their learning outcomes, and this $220,000 project was designed to inform, guide and support sustainable development of learning and teaching spaces and practices, maximising flexibility so as to be used by as many disciplines as feasible.

projects.title: Learning Landscape Project
projects.description: The Learning Landscape Project aimed to develop a descriptive framework for learning and teaching across the University of Cambridge.  With a broad remit to describe teaching and learning practices and processes in the University and Colleges we worked with staff, students, and alumni in order to create a "map" of teaching and learning at Cambridge. The map then formed the basis for cross fertilization of teaching and learning practice, the development of new teaching and learning innovations and facilitating change.

authors.headline: Founder and CEO @ RocketShoes Pty Ltd | Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
RocketShoes is an independent consultancy providing advisory and educational design and development services in the higher education industry.  We specialise in helping online learning design and development teams improve systems, processes and management practices; helping them partner or develop internal capability; and scaling capacity.

RocketShoes was founded as an edtech startup to develop a next-generation educational platform based on the NEM Blockchain and decentralised file management system IPFS.  The RocketShoes platform is a blockchain-powered digital asset platform for the future of education and work.

Key achievements:
•	Researched and developed concept and proposal in consultation with industry leaders.
•	Achieved $1.1M seed funding on first attempt from NEM Community Foundation.
•	Partnered with TypeHuman on development.
•	Established Company's Mission and Vision.

Services:
•	Digital Strategy for education, particularly focusing on emerging technologies.
•	Conducting workshops and professional development on a range of education transformation topics.
•	Research and analysis, including gathering insights, future readiness audits, stakeholder engagement.
•	Program, Project and Change Management, specialising in future thinking, Web 3.0, Blockchain, XR and innovative learning space projects, including development of software and solutions.

profile_positions.description: Guest lecturer for Melbourne School of Design Studio 23: Digital Natives, 2022.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
As Director of Educational Innovation I led the design, implementation, training and ongoing refinement of the university's approach to digital learning, including the use of technology to deliver fully online courses and to enhance face-to-face learning. The position required advanced skills and experience in fostering creativity and innovation in teaching and learning and the ability to work collaboratively with and influence and inspire others. Key responsibilities included:

• Academic leadership and project vision for the La Trobe Online strategic initiative for the university on a day to day basis.
• Lead the implementation of innovative approaches to teaching and learning that leverage emerging technologies, including oversight of the design and development of online and blended courses.
• Explore and engage with the possibilities presented by new internal and external partnerships and emerging technologies in digital learning.
• Lead the continued development and implementation of La Trobe's online and blended learning strategy and product development.
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor and Director of Educational Innovation

profile_positions.description:
The Director of Digital Learning plays a key leadership role in the successful implementation of La Trobe's digital learning strategy.  This role includes managing relationships with external partners in online learning development, implementing strategies to increase the number of students in subjects offered by the University in blended learning and online mode, and leadership in course and subject design and development for digital learning resulting in innovation and quality improvement in courses and subjects.

Key achievements in this role include:

- Concept development, funding submission development and business ownership of La Trobe Online, an entirely new fully online start up entity within La Trobe (3 years, up to 26.5 FTE).
- Day to day responsibility for vision and strategy for La Trobe Online, including establishing a market strategy, business model, change process and student experience strategy, and team recruitment to execute.
- Vision for and project sponsorship of digital learning strategy Innovations Grants (3 major, 10 minor, $400K / year).
- Establishment of the university's first Mobile Learning team, and responsibility for the conversion of the MBA into a Mobile First design.
- Concept development and vision for a project to establish 10 new One Button Studios under the digital learning strategy over 2015-16.
- Project sponsorship and chair of steering committee for a project to move the University's Learning Management System to SaaS during 2015.
profile_positions.title: Director of Digital Learning

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to the PVC (Teaching and Learning) this role leads a team delivering on the teaching and learning objectives within La Trobe’s Future Ready strategy. This includes making original and innovative contributions to the advancement of teaching and learning, providing university-wide leadership in the development of curriculum and the development of pedagogy, and promoting, supporting and undertaking high quality and high impact research in the scholarship of teaching and learning. Key achievements:
• Acting Pro Vice Chancellor (Future Learning) (4 months)
• Deputising for Pro Vice Chancellor (Teaching and Learning)
• Co-authorship of La Trobe’s Digital Learning Strategy (2015-2017) with an expected budget of over $20M.
• Academic leadership of the introduction of the Hallmark Program for high achieving students across the university.
• Member of the project control group and significant input into the PS3 Project, an $18.7M project to develop state of the art active, collaborative and blended learning spaces.
• Provide leadership and direction to LTLT’s team of Educational Developers and Educational Designers (16 people), to ensure an effective and coherent team approach to the implementation of the University’s Future Ready strategy.
• Lead the development of programs and strategies to increase academic staff capacity to teach in flexible, blended and/or online learning environments.
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor and Director (Educational Development and Design)

profile_positions.description: The Director of Digital Learning plays a key leadership role in the successful implementation of La Trobe's online and blended learning strategies, and educational innovation to improve student learning. The role is focused on the continued development and implementationof online and blended learning strategies described in Future Ready, the achievement of related goals and targets and leading innovation to improve the quality of digital taeching and learning across the university. The role includes managing relationships with external partners in online learning development, implementing strategies to increase the number of students in subjects offered by the University in blended learning mode and leadership in course and subject design and development for digital learning resulting in innovation and quality improvement in courses and subjects.
profile_positions.title: Acting Pro Vice-Chancellor (Future Learning) / Director of Digital Learning

Areas of responsibility include:
•	Manage the Faculty’s approach to teaching and learning that aligns with the Faculty and University’s strategic plans
•	Assist schools and departments to implement La Trobe University’s 'Design for Learning' project
•	Ensure quality assurance of the Faculty’s teaching and learning operations
•	Lead and manage academic and professional teams on all aspects of curriculum renewal within the Faculty
•	Lead and manage the Faculty’s work integrated learning team to support and expand our WIL offerings
•	Lead and manage the Faculty’s First Year Experience Coordinator
•	Lead and manage the Faculty’s eLearning Design team

•	Serve on various University and Faculty committees

profile_positions.title: Acting Associate Dean (Academic)

profile_positions.description:
The main objective of the position is to provide educational design advice and support to academic staff on the development of high quality teaching resources and experiences which is based on:
• sound pedagogical teaching and learning strategies used to guide best practice in the use of online teaching approaches and flexible learning experiences;
• effective content and resource design; and
• assessment strategies that reflect the diversity of learners and the educational objectives of the Faculty.
profile_positions.title: Educational Designer

profile_positions.description: Three month sabbatical organised through Outside Studies Program at La Trobe to be a visiting scholar at Philosophy & Ethics, TU Eindhoven.  During this time I am conducting research in the areas of educational technologies and social studies of technology, in particular around the theme of affective assemblages, looking at the idea of 'gezelligheid' as a potential principle of learning space design, mobile technologies and blended learning strategy.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Scholar

profile_positions.location: Centre for Applied Research in Educational Technologies
profile_positions.description: During 2006 I led the development phase of the Knowledge Resource Network Project, sponsored by the Cambridge-MIT Institute to further the exchange and reuse of teaching materials in higher education using an applied research approach. Between August 2006 and January 2008 I was one of two lead researchers on the Learning Landscape Project (LLP), a major University-wide initiative. LLP aims to develop a descriptive framework for learning and teaching across the University, and is focused on the engagement of students, staff and alumni in order to identify opportunities for cross fertilization of ideas and practical initiatives. As part of my duties on this project I was responsible for hiring and managing two part-time research assistants.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description:
This role involved the design and development of innovative interactive courseware in collaboration with the clients and co-workers. The position also contributed to the ongoing development of new technologies and methods for developing courseware and played a key role in enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of courseware development. Leadership in the implementation of quality processes in courseware development is expected and this includes:
•	Project management, including coordination of the needs analysis, design and production processes for complex projects, in consultation with technical and media staff
•	Advising on and assisting with the development of technology-based and online learning environments
•	Reviewing and recommending appropriate learning theories to effect the learning outcomes of the academic program conducted by the client academics
•	Developing detailed pedagogical designs married to appropriate technical infrastructure and systems, and documenting these in a specifications document
•	Developing and documenting operational practices to ensure that the procedures followed in project design and development are best able to meet the needs of both CDS (Courseware Development Section) and academic clients
•	Ensuring the cross-fertilisation of ideas, tools and models of good practice across the University
profile_positions.title: Educational Designer

profile_positions.description:
This position involved research into novel teaching methods involving
 information technology, and the development of software based on this
 work. The position required an extensive knowledge of multimedia
 production, interface design, and an understanding of educational
 design principles. I worked with academics and multimedia experts in
 teams to produce high quality multimedia software, and assisted the
 Science Multimedia Teaching Unit in evaluating, installing and
 demonstrating new and existing educational software.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
This position involved assisting departmental staff to produce high
 quality multimedia software, development of similar software for use by
 departments and the Faculty of Science, and assisting the Science
 Multimedia Teaching Unit in evaluating, installing and demonstrating
 new and existing computer software, and installing and maintaining
 computer hardware as required.
